t: Jeremiah 49
Judgment on Ammon
Against*p the Ammonites. Thus*p says the Lord:*s “Has*pn Israel no sons? Has*ld he no heir? Why*ld then*i does Milcom inherit Gad, And*ld his people dwell in its cities?

Therefore*ld behold, the days are coming,” says the Lord,*s “That*ld I will cause to be heard an alarm of war In*ld Rabbah of the Ammonites; It*ld shall be a desolate mound, And*ld her villages shall be burned with fire. Then*ld Israel shall take possession of his inheritance,” says the Lord.*s

“Wail,*ln O Heshbon, for Ai is plundered! Cry,*ld you daughters of Rabbah, Gird*ld yourselves with sackcloth! Lament*ld and run to and fro by the walls; For*ld Milcom shall go into captivity With*ld his priests and his princes together.
Why*ld do you boast in the valleys, Your*ld flowing valley, O backsliding daughter? Who*ld trusted in her treasures, saying,*i ‘Who*ld will come against me?’

Behold,*ld I will bring fear upon you,” Says*ld the Lord God*s of hosts, “From*ld all those who are around you; You*ld shall be driven out, everyone headlong, And*ld no one will gather those who wander off.
But*ld afterward I will bring back The*ld captives of the people of Ammon,” says the Lord.*s
Judgment on Edom
Against*p Edom. Thus*p says the Lord*s of hosts: “Is*ipn wisdom no more in Teman? Has*ld counsel perished from the prudent? Has*ld their wisdom vanished?
Flee,*ld turn back, dwell in the depths, O inhabitants of Dedan! For*ld I will bring the calamity of Esau upon him, The*ld time that*i I will punish him.
If*ld grape-gatherers came to you, Would*ld they not leave some*i gleaning grapes? If*ld thieves by night, Would*ld they not destroy until they have enough?

But*ld I have made Esau bare; I*ld have uncovered his secret places, And*ld he shall not be able to hide himself. His*ld descendants are plundered, His*ld brethren and his neighbors, And*ld he is*i no more.
Leave*ld your fatherless children, I*ld will preserve them*i alive; And*ld let your widows trust in Me.”

For*p thus says the Lord:*s “Behold, those whose judgment was*i not to drink of the cup have assuredly drunk. And are*i you the one who will altogether go unpunished? You shall not go unpunished, but you shall surely drink of*i it.*i
For I have sworn by Myself,” says the Lord,*s “that Bozrah shall become a desolation, a reproach, a waste, and a curse. And all its cities shall be perpetual wastes.”
I*pn have heard a message from the Lord,*s And*ld an ambassador has been sent to the nations: “Gather*ld together, come against her, And*ld rise up to battle!
“For*ln indeed, I will make you small among nations, Despised*ld among men.

Your*ld fierceness has deceived you, The*ld pride of your heart, O*ld you who dwell in the clefts of the rock, Who*ld hold the height of the hill! Though*ld you make your nest as high as the eagle, I*ld will bring you down from there,” says the Lord.*s
“Edom*ln also shall be an astonishment; Everyone*ld who goes by it will be astonished And*ld will hiss at all its plagues.
As*ld in the overthrow of Sodom and Gomorrah And*ld their neighbors,” says the Lord,*s “No*ld one shall remain there, Nor*ld shall a son of man dwell in it.

“Behold,*ln he shall come up like a lion from the floodplain of the Jordan Against*ld the dwelling place of the strong; But*ld I will suddenly make him run away from her. And*ld who is*i a chosen man*i that*i I may appoint over her? For*ld who is*i like Me? Who*ld will arraign Me? And*ld who is*i that shepherd Who*ld will withstand Me?”

Therefore*ln hear the counsel of the Lord*s that He has taken against Edom, And*ld His purposes that He has proposed against the inhabitants of Teman: Surely*ld the least of the flock shall draw them out; Surely*ld He shall make their dwelling places desolate with them.
The*ld earth shakes at the noise of their fall; At*ld the cry its noise is heard at the Red Sea.
Behold,*ld He shall come up and fly like the eagle, And*ld spread His wings over Bozrah; The*ld heart of the mighty men of Edom in that day shall be Like*ld the heart of a woman in birth pangs.
Judgment on Damascus
Against*p Damascus. “Hamath*pn and Arpad are shamed, For*ld they have heard bad news. They*ld are fainthearted; There*ild is*i trouble on the sea; It*ld cannot be quiet.
Damascus*ld has grown feeble; She*ld turns to flee, And*ld fear has seized her.*i Anguish*ld and sorrows have taken her like a woman in labor.
Why*ld is the city of praise not deserted, the city of My joy?
Therefore*ld her young men shall fall in her streets, And*ld all the men of war shall be cut off in that day,” says the Lord*s of hosts.
“I*ld will kindle a fire in the wall of Damascus, And*ld it shall consume the palaces of Ben-Hadad.”
Judgment on Kedar and Hazor
Against*p Kedar and against the kingdoms of Hazor, which Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon shall strike. Thus*p says the Lord:*s “Arise,*pn go up to Kedar, And*ld devastate the men of the East!

Their*ld tents and their flocks they shall take away. They*ld shall take for themselves their curtains, All*ld their vessels and their camels; And*ld they shall cry out to them, ‘Fear*ld is*i on every side!’

“Flee,*ln get far away! Dwell in the depths, O*ld inhabitants of Hazor!” says the Lord.*s “For*ld Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon has taken counsel against you, And*ld has conceived a plan against you.
“Arise,*ln go up to the wealthy nation that dwells securely,” says the Lord,*s “Which*ld has neither gates nor bars, Dwelling*ld alone.

Their*ld camels shall be for booty, And*ld the multitude of their cattle for plunder. I*ld will scatter to all winds those in the farthest corners, And*ld I will bring their calamity from all its sides,” says the Lord.*s
“Hazor*ld shall be a dwelling for jackals, a desolation forever; No*ld one shall reside there, Nor*ld son of man dwell in it.”
Judgment on Elam
The*p word of the Lord*s that came to Jeremiah the prophet against Elam, in the beginning of the reign of Zedekiah king of Judah, saying,
“Thus says the Lord*s of hosts: ‘Behold,*pn I will break the bow of Elam, The*ld foremost of their might.
Against*ld Elam I will bring the four winds From*ld the four quarters of heaven, And*ld scatter them toward all those winds; There*ld shall be no nations where the outcasts of Elam will not go.

For*ld I will cause Elam to be dismayed before their enemies And*ld before those who seek their life. I*ld will bring disaster upon them, My*ld fierce anger,’ says the Lord;*s ‘And*ld I will send the sword after them Until*ld I have consumed them.
I*ld will set My throne in Elam, And*ld will destroy from there the king and the princes,’ says the Lord.*s
‘But*ln it shall come to pass in the latter days: I*ld will bring back the captives of Elam,’ says the Lord.”*s
